messages.content:
You are a systematic literature review (SLR) screening assistant.


DOMAIN: AI/ML/DL applications in ophthalmology and eye diseases.

RELEVANT DISEASES:
- Diabetic Retinopathy
- Glaucoma
- Cataract
- Age-related Macular Degeneration (AMD)
- Retinal disorders (retinopathy, retinal detachment, etc.)
- Ophthalmic conditions (keratoconus, dry eye, etc.)
- Any eye/vision-related diseases

RELEVANT TASKS:
- Diagnosis
- Detection
- Classification
- Severity grading
- Prediction
- Segmentation
- Screening

RELEVANT METHODS:
- Artificial Intelligence (AI)
- Machine Learning (ML)
- Deep Learning (DL)
- Neural Networks (CNN, RNN, Transformers, etc.)
- Computer Vision
- Image Analysis


================================================================================
TASK: Evaluate this paper ABSTRACT for inclusion.
(This paper passed title screening)
================================================================================

TITLE: A Multi-Scale Self-Attention Network for Diabetic Retinopathy Retrieval
ABSTRACT: Diabetic retinopathy (DR), a complication due to diabetes, is a common cause of progressive damage to the retina. The mass screening of populations for DR is time-consuming. Therefore, computerized diagnosis is of great significance in the clinical practice, which providing evidence to assist clinicians in decision making. Specifically, hemorrhages, microaneurysms, hard exudates, soft exudates, and other lesions are verified to be closely associated with DR. These lesions, however, are scattered in different positions and sizes in fundus images, the internal relation of which are hard to be reserved in the ultimate features due to a large number of convolution layers that reduce the detail characteristics. In this paper, we present a deep-learning network with a multi-scale self-attention module to aggregate the global context to learned features for DR image retrieval. The multi-scale fusion enhances, in terms of scale, the efficacious latent relation of different positions in features explored by the self-attention. For the experiment, the proposed network is validated on the Kaggle DR dataset, and the result shows that it achieves state-of-the-art performance.

================================================================================
SELECTION RULES (BE INCLUSIVE - DO NOT MISS RELEVANT PAPERS):
================================================================================

OUTPUT: Abstract_Selected
IF ANY of the following is TRUE:
- Abstract confirms AI/ML/DL method for eye disease
- Abstract describes automated diagnosis/detection for ophthalmology
- Abstract mentions dataset of retinal/fundus/OCT images with ML analysis
- Abstract is UNCLEAR but suggests AI application in eye care
- Abstract describes deep learning model for any eye condition

OUTPUT: Abstract_Deleted
ONLY IF the abstract CLEARLY confirms:
- This is a review/survey/meta-analysis paper (not primary research)
- No AI/ML/DL methodology is used at all
- The disease is NOT eye-related
- The paper is editorial/commentary/opinion only

================================================================================
IMPORTANT: When abstract is missing or unclear, SELECT (Abstract_Selected).
We prefer false positives over missing relevant papers.
================================================================================

OUTPUT: Respond with EXACTLY one label only (no explanation):
Abstract_Selected
OR
Abstract_Deleted

YOUR RESPONSE:
